data
Interface Bookshelf

public interface Bookshelf

The Bookshelf public interface represents a set of books.

Author:
Andrew Alm

Method Summary
 void addBook(Book book)
          Add a new book into the bookshelf.
 boolean contains(Book book)
          Determines whether the biven Book is on the Bookshelf.
 java.util.Iterator<Book> getBooks()
          Return an iterator to run through all books on the bookshelf, sorted by relevancy.
 void removeBook(Book book)
          Remove a Book from the Bookshelf.
 Bookshelf subshelf(Book book)
          Creates a new bookshelf containing only books similar to the given book.
 Bookshelf union(Bookshelf shelf)
          Returns a new Bookshelf containing all items on each bookshelf.

contains

boolean contains(Book book)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Determines whether the biven Book is on the Bookshelf.

Parameters:
book - the Book to search for
Returns:
true if the book is on the bookshelf, otherwise false
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the book given is null

getBooks

java.util.Iterator<Book> getBooks()
Return an iterator to run through all books on the bookshelf, sorted by relevancy.

Returns:
an Iterator of all the Books on the Bookshelf

union

                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Returns a new Bookshelf containing all items on each bookshelf.

Parameters:
shelf - the Bookshelf to union this Bookshelf with
Returns:
a new Bookshelf.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if shelf is null

                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
